revision.text: {{talkheader}} {{ArticleHistory |action1=WPR |action1date=12:39, 3 December 2006 |action1link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Peer review/Invasion of Tulagi (May 1942) |action1oldid=91650305 |action2=WAR |action2date=03:42, 8 December 2006 |action2link=Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Invasion of Tulagi (May 1942) |action2result=approved |action2oldid=92632656 |action3=FAC |action3date=15:59, 8 December 2006 |action3link=Wikipedia:Featured article candidates/Invasion of Tulagi (May 1942) |action3result=promoted |action3oldid=92883520 |otddate=3 May 2009 |currentstatus=FA |maindate=May 3, 2012 }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WP Australia|class=FA|importance=Mid|military=y|military-importance=Mid}} {{WikiProject Japan|class=FA|importance=high}} {{WikiProject Melanesia|class=FA|SI=yes}} {{WPMILHIST|class=FA|A-Class=pass|old-peer-review=yes|Aviation=y|ANZSP=y|British=y|Japanese=y|Maritime=y|US=y|WWII=y}} }} {{OnThisDay|date1=2011-05-03|oldid1=427137930|date2=2014-05-03|oldid2=606750773}} ==Commanders== I'm not sure about the meaningfulness of including coastwatch co-ordinators (Feldt), civilian administrators (Marchant) and junior officers (Goode and Peagam) as "commanders" in the campaignbox. IMHO, while some of these were highly significant tactically, integrated Allied commands existed in the Pacific as early as January 1942. So I think it would be better to mention only Fletcher from the Allied side. [[User:Grant65|Grant65]] | [[User talk:Grant65|Talk]] 14:14, 27 November 2006 (UTC) :Agreed, although Marchant was technically the military commander of the British Solomon Islands (according to Lord's book) even though he appears to have abdicated that responsibility to other Allied commanders. Also, after the Tulagi occupation, the only Allied forces in the Solomons (apart from some Australian commandos on Bougainville) were the coastwatchers under Feldt. I'll take out all but Marchant's and Fletcher's names from the infobox. [[User:Cla68|Cla68]] 23:34, 27 November 2006 (UTC) == Typo? == "Yorktown SBD aircraft return to their carrier after striking Japanese shipping in Tulagi harbor". Should it be "Yorktown SBD aircraft returns" or "Yorktown SBD aircrafts return" (as there are several aircrafts depicted)? --[[User:Brandmeister|Brand]] [[User talk:Brandmeister|спойт]] 14:29, 4 December 2006 (UTC) :The plural for aircraft is "aircraft" ([http://www.m-w.com/dictionary/aircraft]). Therefore, it is correct as currently written. [[User:Cla68|Cla68]] 23:10, 4 December 2006 (UTC) ::Lol, my major issue :P:)) --[[User:Brandmeister|Brand]] [[User talk:Brandmeister|спойт]] 11:11, 5 December 2006 (UTC) == Casualties and losses == In the list of Japanese casualties and losses the same line "1 destroyer" is there twice. —Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Bennor|Bennor]] ([[User talk:Bennor|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Bennor|contribs]]) 07:00, 3 May 2009 (UTC) :That's because one destroyer was sunk and one damaged. [[User:Cla68|Cla68]] ([[User talk:Cla68|talk]]) 10:26, 3 May 2009 (UTC)
